C:\Documents and Settings\El Frederico\My Documents\svn\components\EventLog\log.php
Define the event types.

$var ezcLogMap Contains the mapping between the log message and the writer. This mapping specifies the format and storage of the log entries. For example: write the Audit trails to the database, and the error messages to a file and a stream.
$var ezcLogContext Stores the context of the eventType and eventSources
@var Log Store the instance of this class.
Don't call the constructor, use the getInstance method instead to get an Logger object.
Returns the instance of the class. @returns Instance of this class.
Set default logging values.
Enable writer exceptions to be thrown when an log entry couldn't be written in a specific writer.
Disable writer exceptions to be thrown when an log entry couldn't be written in a specific writer. Actually, this is quite the opposite of enableWriterExceptions() :-).
Returns an array with the writers attached to the log. @return array(ezcLogWriter)
@param array(string) $eventTypeSources Array with eventSources (strings) which will trigger a certain context. @param array(string => string) context Array with context strings.
Write the log message to the correct writer.
Usually called by the trigger_error function. This method calls the log function.

C:\Documents and Settings\El Frederico\My Documents\svn\components\EventLog\log\writer.php

Write the logEntries to a specific group. The group can specify to where the entry should be written. In the case of a database it can be a column. If the writer writes to file it can be to specify the file name. @param array logEntries An array with strings specifying each column to be written.

@var file_handles Contains the open files.
@var ezcLogMap Keeps track of which group of messages should be stored in which file.
Sets the log rotation size of the files. @param integer $size Maximum file size in bytes.
Returns the log rotation size in bytes. @returns integer
Sets the maximum number of log rotated files. @param integer $nrOfFiles
Set The Log directory to where the files will be written.

The function that actually writes the log entry. The logEntry is an array describing the entries that should be logged. $logEntry["message"] The log message. $logEntry["type"] The severity. $logEntry["source"] The source. $logEntry["category"] The category. @returns boolean Returns true when the log entry is correctly written.
Open file and rotate log automatically.
Rotate log.
